/* Trivia */ another stab at the hair trivia. brevity with ACS' clarity.
site focuses on comics, no direct ties to new film news
Fixed someone's previous edits to be cleaner
/* Filming */ Added citation for official announcement
/* External links */ Removed spam; trailer and wallpapers already available at official movie site and Apple site
/* Film score */ removing redundancy: "in place of Elfman's vacancy" —> "in Elfman's vacancy
Fixed fourth villain mention in plot outline; cleaned up Film score section
/* Plot outline */ Please cite anything about the "symbiote" being a villain; otherwise leave as ambiguous
Cleaned up production section, removed some unverified rumors lacking citation - tried to uncover valid sources to no avail
/* Production */ Added Grant Curtis' blog, please clean-up
/* Unverified */ don't need {fact} because they are assumptions that have not been verified, you can't verify something that's "unverified"
/* Harry Osborn */ doesn't need to be said twice, and someone needs to find the video interviews on the website the show him saying this
Cleaned up James Franco/Osborn section, needs more citations to address statements made
/* New actors */ reworded Church's part putting his name before dunst's so it does not get confusing...
Comparing the design to a "paintball player on a snowboard" seems to be rather opinionated and misleading.

check other sources, BOM has been wrong many times about budgets, LA Times, TheNumbers.com, and other sources have reported X3's budget as lower than 200 million ((BOM still lists Superman's at 260)
/* Production */ Missing bracket and additional correction

Please check citation; it says Spider-man 3's budget was $250 million, and BoxOfficeMojo indicates X-men 3 had a budget of $210 million, which is larger than King Kong's $207 million from the same sit
